articles.author: Howard Schneider
articles.title: Fed policymakers broadly see eye to eye on 2020 outlook
articles.description: Federal Reserve policymakers who last year were frequently at odds over where to set U.S. borrowing costs opened 2020 telegraphing confidence in the state of the economy and signalling broad agreement that monetary policy is right where it should be.

articles.author: Danny Ramos
articles.title: Bolivia's electoral court sets election rerun for May 3
articles.description: A rerun of Bolivia's election has been set for Sunday May 3, the president of the country's Supreme Electoral Tribunal said on Friday.
articles.content:
LA PAZ (Reuters) - A rerun of Bolivia’s election has been set for Sunday May 3, the president of the country’s Supreme Electoral Tribunal said on Friday. 
Salvador Romero said both presidential and parliamentary elections would be held on the same day. 
“Wh… [+1488 chars]

articles.author: Ezgi Erkoyun
articles.title: Ghosn used our jets illegally in escape from Japan, Turkish company says
articles.description: A Turkish private jet operator said on Friday that ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn used two of its planes illegally in his escape from Japan, with an employee falsifying lease records to exclude his name from the documents.
articles.content:
ISTANBUL/TOKYO (Reuters) - A Turkish private jet operator said on Friday that ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn used two of its planes illegally in his escape from Japan, with an employee falsifying lease records to exclude his name from the documents.

articles.title: U.S. Soccer cancels training camp in Qatar after unrest

articles.author: Nick Mulvenney
articles.title: Cricket-Labuschagne bats on after New Zealand double strike
articles.description: Marnus Labuschagne was 181 not out as Australia reached 354 for five at lunch on the second day of the third test against New Zealand at a sunbathed Sydney Cricket Ground on Saturday.
articles.content:
SYDNEY (Reuters) - Marnus Labuschagne was 181 not out as Australia reached 354 for five at lunch on the second day of the third test against New Zealand at a sunbathed Sydney Cricket Ground on Saturday.

articles.title: Reports: Nationals, 2B Castro agree to two-year deal
articles.description: Free-agent second baseman Starlin Castro has agreed to a two-year, $12 million deal with the Washington Nationals, according to multiple reports Friday.
articles.content:
Free-agent second baseman Starlin Castro has agreed to a two-year, $12 million deal with the Washington Nationals, according to multiple reports Friday.

articles.author: Sonali Paul
articles.title: First Australian bushfire evacuees land in Melbourne
articles.description: The first of thousands of residents and vacationers stranded on a beach in southeastern Australia landed near Melbourne on Saturday morning after a 20-hour journey by ship, relieved to escape terrifying smoke and fire.
articles.content:

articles.title: Mexico City goes back to the future with plastic bag ban
articles.description: Mexico City's new ban on plastic bags has inspired visions of a journey back in time even as local makers of the packaging worry they could become obsolete.

articles.title: Hanukkah stabbing suspect indicted in New York on six counts of attempted murder
